content.en: Intelligent database systems: Researchers are exploring how to develop expert database systems that can support knowledge-based applications, making databases 'active' agents that can reason and support AI applications. They are also investigating the use of pattern recognition algorithms and symbolic programming to infer data dependencies from user-supplied data instances. Additionally, algorithms are being proposed to detect second-path inferences in relational database systems and to compute the transitive closure of large database relations efficiently. These advancements aim to improve the design, analysis, and efficiency of databases, and to integrate artificial intelligence into databases to create intelligent information systems.
content.da: Intelligente databasesystemer: Forskere undersøger, hvordan man udvikler ekspert-databasesystemer, der kan understøtte videnbaserede applikationer, og gøre databaser til 'aktive' agenter, der kan ræsonnere og understøtte AI-applikationer. De undersøger også brugen af mønstergenkendelsesalgoritmer og symbolsk programmering for at udlede datadependenser fra brugerspecifikke dataeksempler. Derudover foreslås algoritmer til at detektere andenvejsslutninger i relationelle databasesystemer og til effektivt at beregne den transitive lukning af store databasemængder. Disse fremskridt sigter mod at forbedre design, analyse og effektivitet af databaser og at integrere kunstig intelligens i databaser for at skabe intelligente informationssystemer.
